qas.question: A robin has a special food called 'dax' to feed its babies. Which is more likely to also use dax: a sparrow (another bird) or a butterfly (looks similar but is an insect)?
A dog has a tiny bone inside its ear. Which is more likely to also have a tiny ear bone: a cat (another animal) or a robot that looks like a dog?
A whale has a special fat called zorp inside. Which is more likely to have zorp: a dolphin (another sea mammal) or a shark (looks similar but is a fish)?
A cow has a type of blood called mip. Which is more likely to also have mip: a goat (another farm animal) or a horse toy that looks like a horse?
A lizard has a special skin called dorb. Which is more likely to have dorb: a snake (another reptile) or a worm (looks a bit like a snake)?
A duck has a food called nif for its babies. Which is more likely to also use nif: a goose (another bird) or a bat (flies but is a mammal)?
A turtle has a little organ called tav. Which is more likely to have tav: a tortoise (another reptile) or a crab (has a shell)?
A bee has a special juice called pim. Which is more likely to have pim: a wasp (another insect) or a hummingbird (flies too)?
A frog has a sound called zum in its throat. Which is more likely to also have zum: a toad (another amphibian) or a fish (lives in water)?
A lion has a special tooth called keb. Which is more likely to also have keb: a tiger (another big cat) or a dog (looks less like a cat)?
A parrot has a feather called lod. Which is more likely to also have lod: a pigeon (another bird) or a butterfly (has wings)?
